The electron is injected into the electric field with an initial velocity \( v_0 = 4 	imes 10^6 \, \mathrm{m/s} \).
The electron exits the electric field at point \( C \) with its velocity direction forming a \( 30^\circ \) angle with \( v_0 \).
The kinetic energy of the electron at point \( C \) can be calculated using the formula \( KE =  rac{1}{2}mv^2 \).
The velocity \( v \) at point \( C \) can be found using the relationship \( v =  rac{v_0}{\cos(30^\circ)} \).
Substituting the values, \( v =  rac{4 	imes 10^6}{\cos(30^\circ)} \approx 4.62 	imes 10^6 \, \mathrm{m/s} \).
The mass of the electron is \( m = 0.91 	imes 10^{-30} \, \mathrm{kg} \).
Substituting the values into the kinetic energy formula, \( KE =  rac{1}{2} 	imes 0.91 	imes 10^{-30} 	imes (4.62 	imes 10^6)^2 \approx 9.7 	imes 10^{-18} \, \mathrm{J} \).
